Challenge: In OTL, Rudolf, Crown Prince of Austria married Stephanie of Belgium. The marriage was unhappy, which lead to him having an affair with a baroness, and in 1889, killing himself, in a Suicide pact.

Find an alternate wife for Rudolf, for him to marry, that won’t cause him to have an affair, and commit suicide.

Just let Rudi marry Antonietta of Tuscany (his dad refused because of her weak health, she died two years later), and then once she shuffles off, there's a WHOLE new batch of candidates.

Otherwise, Maria Teresa of Bragança (daughter of D. Miguel) and a daughter of Isabel II were under consideration. MT refused Rudolf to marry his uncle, while Rudi wasn't particularly taken with Maria del Pilar IIRC.

Challenge: In OTL, Rudolf, Crown Prince of Austria married Stephanie of Belgium. The marriage was unhappy, which lead to him having an affair with a baroness, and in 1889, killing himself, in a Suicide pact.

Find an alternate wife for Rudolf, for him to marry, that won’t cause him to have an affair, and commit suicide.

His wife was the last of Rudolf’s problem and Mary was in no way the first or only lover of Rudolf (who had also other mistresses during the 3 months of his affair with her).

Being son of his parents was cause of most of his troubles and unhappiness... A different mother (as Elisabeth herself had likely mental troubles, and Rudolf was not helped by the fact who his parents were first cousins, three of his four grandparents were Wittelsbachs and the fourth was son of double first cousins) or an earlier death of his father would help Rudolf much more than a different wife.

Potential Brides:

- Princess Louise of Belgium, (18/2/1858-1/3/1924) Catholic, eldest daughter of Leopold II and his wife, Marie Henriette of Austria.

- [URL='https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maria_Christina_of_Austria']Maria Christina of Austria-Este[/URL], (21/7/1858–6/2/1929), daughter of Archduke Karl Ferdinand of Austria and his wife, Archduchess Elisabeth Franziska of Austria.

- Princess Isabella of Bavaria (31/8/1863–26/2/1924) was the third child and eldest daughter of Prince Adalbert of Bavaria and his wife Infanta Amalia of Spain.

- Infanta Adelgundes, Duchess of Guimarães (10/11/1858–15/4/1946) was the fifth child and fourth daughter of Miguel of Portugal and his wife Adelaide of Löwenstein-Wertheim-Rosenberg.

- Princess Marie of Orléans (13/1/1865–4/12/1909)

- Princess Charlotte of Prussia (24/7/1860–1/10/1919), the second child and eldest daughter of Prince Frederick of Prussia, (future Crown Prince of Prussia and German Emperor) and his wife, Victoria, Princess Royal, making Charlotte the eldest granddaughter of Queen Victoria of Britain and her consort Prince Albert. Although a Protestant, it could be potentially an alliance between Prussia and Austria.
